alert.note: Alert for Lyon (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 08 at 11:37AM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Walker River Near Mason at Snyder Lane affecting Lyon County. .River flows will decrease into the weekend dropping to near-below Moderate Flood Stage as runoff from thunderstorm rainfall earlier this week makes its way down the river. Snowmelt and increased reservoir releases will keep the river above Flood Stage through the weekend. Runoff of rain from thunderstorms into tributaries above and below Mason could further exacerbate river flows. For the Mainstem Walker River...including Mason at Snyder Lane... Moderate flooding is occurring. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast through at least Friday. * WHERE...Walker River Near Mason at Snyder Lane. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.3 feet, Moderate flooding of lowlands to farm and pasture lands throughout the Mason Valley-Yerington area. Some low structures adjacent to river begin to flood. Several secondary and some primary roads flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:05 AM PDT Thursday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:05 AM PDT Thursday was 11.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 10.7 feet early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 9.8 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.cnrfc.noaa.gov. The next statement will be issued by late Friday afternoon.
